revised_title: Interpretation of Beta-Ray Spectra and Nuclear Level Systems
tldr: The authors analyze the beta-ray spectra of radium B and radium C, deducing the energy differences of stationary states in the nucleus. They discuss the ejection of natural beta-ray groups and the similarities between the level systems of radium B and radium C. The study also explores the internal conversion of y-rays and its implications for understanding the nucleus and electronic systems.
